p: In summary, viruses present in mosquitoes can travel long distances and enter new countries or even continents, either by the unintentional aid of human transportation, such as aircraft, trains and vehicles, or by birds that feed on infected mosquitoes, travel long distances, and then deposit these viruses in their feces, as reported by Vibin et al. [ 16]. Determining the host range of viruses is essential to understanding the process of potential transmission. Further surveillance and molecular studies are required to fully understand the ecology and evolution of HRLV 7.
